DataElement.preferredName: Patient Correlative Study Tissue Specimen Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no question related to the patient's/participant's consent for the use of tissue samples for correlative study use.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Correlative Study Tissue Specimen Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's/participant's consent for the use of tissue samples for correlative study use.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Studies designed to translate basic science findings into clinically useful tools.  Includes marker research.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A type of study that tests for a relationship between a condition and a potential causal factor of the condition.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.origin: SWOG CRF:Southwest Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was consent signed for tumor tissue correlative biology studies

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient consents to tissue su
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient consents to tissue submission

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient's Consent given for specimen use for this research study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to give his/her tissue sample for research testing

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission for tumor biopsies for research testing

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Willing to provide tissue samples for correlative research purposes

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to give their tissue sample for research testing

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to this sample collection?*

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to 'tumor tissue for molecular profile testing' sample collection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to 'tumor tissue for ALK testing' sample collection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to give his/her tissue sample(s) for research testing planned as part of this study

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to have the week 12 biopsy done for Ki67 analysis and research purposes.  The patient's coded samples and related coded information may be used to learn about, prevent, find or treat the patient's type of cancer.  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to use of snap frozen tissue obtained at diagnosis and/or second surgery for molecular profile studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has a fresh tissue sample been collected

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to the use of leftover tumor tissue in research to learn about how imetelstat works?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to the histopathology of eyes enucleated for disease progression optional study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to optional sample collections for laboratory studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient consented to Tumor Tissue Genomics?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to having bone marrow sample studied to see how much of the protein CRLF2 is present on the leukemia cells?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to use of tumor sample(s) for ALK testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to use of tumor tissue for molecular profile testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was consent signed for optional tumor tissue correlative biology studies

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to provide tissue sample(s) to laboratories associated with Alliance for research testing including genetic sequencing research planned as part of this study

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to use of frozen tumor tissue obtained at the time of diagnosis and at the time of second surgery (if done) for molecular profile studies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has agreed to have a biopsy collected 6 weeks after starting the study drug and has given permission to use his/her specimen sample(s) and related information.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to the use of his/her tumor and blood samples for studies at a COG laboratory to see if genetic changes can be used to predict a subject's response to therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to submitting tumor tissue samples to look for biomarkers that may be used to predict how a person will respond to therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient consents to provision of non-cytology tissue samples, and investigator confirms commitment to obtain this sample so that the specific correlative marker assays may be conducted.
